name: Path N Intrahepatic Bile Ducts
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 3 or more lymph nodes. If the regional lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0. (1)

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:** For right-liver intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, the regional lymph nodes include the hilar (common bile duct, hepatic arteries, portal vein, and cystic duct), periduodenal and peripancreatic lymph nodes. 

**Note 4:** For left-liver intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, regional lymph nodes include hilar and gastrohepatic lymph nodes.

**Note 5:**  Caval nodes are classified as distant nodes and coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Hilar:
        Common bile duct
        Cystic duct
        Hepatic, NOS:
            Hepatic artery
            Hepatic pedicle
        Hepatoduodenal ligament
        Portal vein:
            Porta hepatis
            Periportal
    Inferior phrenic nodes
  
    Primary tumor in left liver (segments 2-4) or lobe of liver not stated:
        Gastrohepatic

    Primary tumor in right liver (segments 5-8) or lobe of liver not stated:
        Periduodenal
        Peripancreatic

     Primary tumor involving both lobes of liver:
         Gastrohepatic
         Periduodenal
         Peripancreatic
footnotes: (1) International Union Against Cancer (UICC) *TNM Classification of Malignant Tumors,* 7th ed., Sobin, LH, Gospodarowicz, M, Wittekind, CH, eds. New York: Wiley, 2009, pg., 116
rows: Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
